fields.summary: Specifying License Details page for Service Desk licensing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1657].
  {panel}

Service Desk requires certain properties on workflow transitions in order to function properly. It would be helpful to have a GUI-based utility to map a custom workflow for use with Service Desk.

The utility would grab all available statuses in a custom workflow and provide drop-down boxes to designate whether each status is:
* Waiting for customer
* Waiting for support
* Resolved

Based on the inputs, the necessary properties would automatically be applied to the workflow. It should include the option to automatically backup the workflow and prompt to check if the workflow should be published after modification.
fields.summary: Utility to Remap JIRA Workflows for use with Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1656].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Currently in Service Desk it's possible to link an entire Confluence Space to use as knowledge base article. No option to link a single page.

h4. Other things to consider
The Anonymous access permissions are usually tied to the space itself, and then you can restrict anonymous access from individual pages. So you would need to be able to somehow ONLY enable anonymous access for a single page without affecting the rest of the space.

h4. Desired resolution.
* the option to link a single page
* the option to allow anonymous access to a single page in Confluence.
fields.summary: Ability to link single Confluence page as Knowledge Base rather than entire space
Allow Service Desk to Use Confluence as Knowledge Base w/o Anonymous
Auto-Scroll Up In Customer Portal With Many Request Type Groups
The dialogue to link a SD project to a Knowledge Base only shows newest 50 Confluence spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1645].
  {panel}

*Current functionality:*
When a service desk title is over a certain number of characters, the title is truncated, and ellipses are added to indicate the title is longer than what is displayed.

There is empty space on this line that would allow for the full text to be rendered.

*Requested functionality:*
The Service Desk title will render in full even if the title is longer than what is currently allowed.
fields.summary: Allow for longer Service Desk titles to be displayed in their entirety

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1644].
  {panel}

I need to significantly dicrease a number of JSD notification. But when I disable notification setting for JIRA Service desk, my custom JIRA notification scheme does NOT take effect. I followed this article: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Configuring+JIRA+Service+Desk+notifications
According to it, my notification scheme must be used after I turn off JSD's one. 
I have found the similar issue descrideb here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/12261159/fewer-service-desk-notifications
PLease help!
fields.summary: Cannot activate customized notification scheme for JIRA Service Desk
Allow use of Tempo timesheets in Service Desk without Agent access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1640].
  {panel}

We have a plugin that injects some javascript into SD customer portal. This plugin embellishes some custom fields with HTML generated based on REST calls to the plugin's REST endpoints. 

Our customer reported that their 'customer' users do not the proper embellishments, instead they get some Javascript error. It turned out that when a user who is not in jira-users (an SD 'customer') is accessing the page with our plugin on it, the plugin makes a REST call that gets 302-redirected to /servicedesk/customer/portal/1. Which means that everything gets broken. Adding @AnonymousAllowed annotation to the plugin's endpoint does not help, as it only works when the user is actually not logged-in. When they log in, apparently SD servlet filter (or whatever) redirects blindly to a bad place. 

This is breaking our plugin in very bad ways and we are likely losing sales because of this. 

Are there any workarounds for this behaviour? I have tried injecting a serlet filter, but it is not being invoked.

The plugin in question is https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.spartez.jira.plugins.ephor-for-jira, but the behaviour can be trivially reproduced with any plugin that has a REST endpoint. Just log in as an SD 'customer' and go to plugin's REST endpoint
fields.summary: SD redirects calls to any plugin's REST endpoints to /servicedesk/customer/portal/1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Create a new User Picker(Multiple User) Custom Field and assign in on Service Desk screen.
# Edit on of the Request Types fields and add the Custom Field.
# Create a new User with a Space e.g. "customer 1"
# Go to Customer Portal and create a request with a Request Type that have the Custom Field.
# Include the "Customer 1" on the field and create the request.

*Expected Result*:
The request will be created

*Actual Result*:
The request is not created and there is an error for the User Picker(Multiple User) Custom Field as seen below.
!userspace.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Multiple User Picker field would not accept Username contain space
Workflow Validator custom error messages Not seen on customer portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1637].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Desription
To allow Service Desk Admin to customize the text / custom fields / links in the Public Sign-up Page/Email Form.
Different companies have different preference over what information is needed from the customer
A certain subset of users will inadvertently glance over the details and when/if that happens, there is no way to proactively prevent them from clicking the wrong link (restart sign up vs continue sign up).

*Sample Email*
{code}
Click the button below to confirm your email address and create your new account!

This email will expire 24 hours after it was sent. You can restart the sign up process here.

Continue sign up
{code}
Ideally, the *continue sign up* link would be first and foremost and the *restart the sign up* link would be smaller at the end of the message.
fields.summary: As an SD Admin, I want the ability to customize the Public Sign-up Form / Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1636].
  {panel}

I'm evaluating JIRA Service Desk plugin (version 2.3.3, should be newest) and faced one "bug". It's not fatal or not even severe but might cause frustation. Seems that it's possible to reply to customer (by transferring to Waiting for customer) by adding only internal comment. Customer will receive notification and from his point of view _nothing_ is commented but request is on his responsibility "Requester action Needed". He might wonder why as there is not comment visible.

I would like to add a new validator (to JIRA Service Desk workflow) that when transferring issue to customer comment is mandatory and it should *not* be internal comment. I couldn't add validator (this is default vanilla JIRA installation, maybe comment presence needs some plugin?). Even there is validator for checking mandatory comment I'm not sure could it be defined that it should be public comment, not internal?

Use case:

FAIL:
- Press "Respond to customer"
- Add internal comment
-> no new information is sent to customer but responsibility is transferred to him

SHOULD BE:
- Press "Respond to customer"
- Require public comment (don't allow internal comment), validator is needed
-> comment is sent to customer

Thanks.
fields.summary: Shouldn't be able to reply to customer with internal comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1635].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a Test Service Desk project and configure Outgoing Mail.
# Logging as Customer that have a working email address into the Test Customer Portal.
# Create a Request.
# Log out and logging in as the Agent of the Test Service Desk project.
# Attach a file and "Respond to Customer" while using the Attachment Text Formatting in the comment:
{code}[^JIRA61_db_schema.pdf]{code}
# Log out.
# Wait until the notification is sent out and check the Customer Mailbox.
# Click on the Attachment Hyperlink.

*Expected Results:*
Customer will be redirected to the Customer Portal before able to view the attachment.

*Actual Result:*
Customer will be redirected to JIRA which they do not have permission to access to.

*Notes:*
* This is the URL generated in the email from the attachment:
{code}http://10.60.4.135:6315/secure/attachment/10001/10001_JIRA61_db_schema.pdf{code}
* where when clicking the URL is changing to:
{code}http://10.60.4.135:6315/login.jsp?permissionViolation=true&os_destination=%2Fsecure%2Fattachment%2F10001%2F10001_JIRA61_db_schema.pdf&page_caps=&user_role={code}
fields.summary: Attachment Hyperlink in Email Notification redirecting to JIRA when customer is not logging in

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1634].
  {panel}

We are in process of evaluating JIRA Service Desk solution setup within our Company.  We tested JSD 1.2 – 2.3 features. We have major blocking Issue for our setup JIRA + JIRA Service Desk. 

First, let me explain our business case Issue. We are using one JIRA project for supporting many different customers.  Customer information is present as custom field data.  Our plan would be having for each customer their own Request Type forms.

Must have:
-          one Customer Portal with many Individual Customer Request Types (Forms),
-          each customer should not have permission to access Request Forms but only their own

This requires:
-          Additional Permission Scheme with Request Type Access level,
-          Or we can define per user access mapping restriction to each Request Type

We can’t implement many projects = Customer Portals as it is current setup.

Is it possible to add this suggestion as new feature?
fields.summary: One Customer Portal with Permission Scheme for Request Type Access (Forms) level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1632].
  {panel}

If you navigate to a service desk via the link at the top of a jira instance

http://cl.ly/image/1m2Y1t320J3C
Service Desk menu -> All Service Desks

http://cl.ly/image/011m401V1900
Find a desk -> Customer Portal

This opens up a dialog. Now, attempt to file a ticket from this dialog. When I clicked on the submit button on the create ticket form, I got a spinner for around 20 seconds. Because of this latency I went to another tab or got a coffee or something, I don't remember what.

When I came back, my spinner was gone and the form was still present with indication of success or failure. I clicked create again. This time I had the same experience. No indication of success or failure.

The ticket in question was created 3 times before I decided to click around in the interface to figure out if it was getting created or not.
fields.summary: Issue created with no indication of success

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1629].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Confluence has the ability to search and pull up text within attachments. 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Searching+Confluence#SearchingConfluence-Searchthecontentofattachments

When linking Service Desk to Confluence, on the Customer Portal, find a solution should also pull up attachments that match the search term.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
Create an application Link between Confluence and JIRA
Go to Service Desk -> Settings -> Link To A Knowledge Base
Select a Space
Go to the Customer Portal -> Search for text within an attachment (reproduced with a PDF)

h3. Expected Results:
The search results bring up pages that also show that include the search term in the attachments

h3. Actual Results:
Pages don't show up that have attachments that include the search term
fields.summary: Find a solution should search content of attachments
Make My Requests more prominent on the Customer Portal Landing page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1627].
{panel}
{panel:title=Product update 5 March 2021}
Hello all, 

Thanks for your votes and feedback on this issue. We see this has an important feature, and is something we hope to implement in the future. It is a complex feature that crosses over a lot of team on our end. As such, we will not be positioned to prioritise this feature until at soonest the beginning of next financial year (July 2021). 

I will update this issue again at that time. 

Cheers, 

Ben.
{panel}
As a Project Administrator, I would like to have the ability to display a different URL for JIRA Service Desk (e.g. support.company.com) instead of jira.xxx.com
h3. Problem Definition

In JIRA Service Desk, customers must access JIRA by using a Service Desk URL, which can sometimes be quite a long path, depending on the portal.
h3. Suggested Solution
 - Create the ability to have a Short URL option on the portal, (like short url's in Confluence pages)
 - Create the ability to have customisable short URL's that could point to different portals in JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Create ability to customize the Customer Portal URL in JIRA Service Management
Create ability to customize the Customer Portal URL in JIRA ServiceDesk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1624].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# *Enable Email Channel* for _Request Type:Get IT Help_ 
# _Request Type: Billing_ has *Email Channel disabled*
# Customer created a request through *Customer Portal*, _Request Type:Billing_
# Agent Responded to the request 
# Customer received the Notification, customer replied to the Notification 
#* Reply to: (is set to the email channel for Get IT Help)
# Comment was not added to the request 
# Email Settings is showing:
!Logs.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Other request types where email channel is not setup. The sender of the notification is jira@ and when you reply  the recipient should also be jira@.

h3. Actual Results
 If one Request Type has Email Channel enabled, and you respond to a Notification with a Request Type that doesn't have Email enabled. The reply to is set to the email channel of the other request instead of jira@.
fields.summary: Comment is not added when Customer replied to an Email Notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1623].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of bug

When trying to raise a new request in Service Desk, the Date Time Picker would show a wrong value for the Time.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Install Service Desk
# Create a Date Time custom field, make sure it appears in the Service Desk screens
# Edit the request form to include the custom field
# Try raising a request, and see the value of the Date time picker :
!datetime.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Notes

* This was tested in Service Desk 2.3.2
* The instance is hosted in my own machine, so there shouldn't be any timezone differences
* The user profile has the same timezone as the machine as well
fields.summary: The time of Date Time Picker is not working well when raising requests

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1618].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Currently JIRA Service Desk Mail Logging is internal to JIRA and it is difficult to capture this information into log files for further analysis. This can make it difficult for our users and Support to identify problems with the JIRA Service Desk Mail handler.
h3. Expected Results

A log file that can be configured for verbosity should exist that shows details of the ServiceDesk and details of it handling mail both inbound, and out-bound.
h3. Actual Results

You need to use the web interface to review the mail log for JIRA Service Desk.
h3. Notes
 * Steps to access the JIRA Service Desk Mail log can be accessed from: [View the email processing and connectivity logs|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/view-the-email-processing-and-connectivity-logs/] It would be great to improve that so we can enable more output to the logs when necessary. Similar to the Incoming Mail in JIRA's Handlers.
 * It would be great as well if there is a way to filter the status that is shown on the log from the UI. Meaning we could just filter what is "Failed" or "Success".
fields.summary: Improve mail logging

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1613].
  {panel}

When we reopen the issue after Resolving the issue 
the resolution won't be "Unset" or "Unresolved", 
but we can add post-function to clear the resolution by [How to Edit the Resolution of an Issue |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Edit+the+Resolution+of+an+Issue].

The problem rises when the SLA of ticket has already stopped when we have resolved it already
and by reopening it, it won't continue from the time we have resolved it. 
As there is no option at  Service Desk >> SLA >> Edit >> Start (Begin counting time when) to set the resolution to "Unset" or "Unresolved".
fields.summary: Continue the SLA After Reopening The Issue
Create Concept of Account

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1611].
  {panel}

A central portal often gets asked for request that are not in its domain.

A certain team might recognise that its not there responsibility but they will be asked anyway.  For example a IT portal could be asked about "office facilities" even if there is another office facilities project or mechanism

So they should be the ability to create "dead end" request types that present themselves in the portal but cannot be submitted.  Instead they act as a information box with links to the place there things should go.

So imagine a RT like :


Standing Desk Requests

The IT team is not responsible for providing standing desks.  This is handled by the Office Team on Level 2.  Click here [http://some.other/portallink] to ask for a standing desk.  Or contact Sherry on ext 2038......
fields.summary: Allow for request types that do not result in issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1596].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Attempting to configure mail in a shared mailbox setting fails with an authentication error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This was reproduced with Office365, however will also occur on other mail servers.

# Setup a shared Office365 mailbox.
# Attempt to setup an Email Channel using JIRA Service Desk with the below configuration:
#* *username:* {{<O365 user name>/<shared mailbox name>}}
#* *password:* {{<O365 user password>}}

h3. Expected Results

JIRA Service Desk is able to connect to the mailbox.

h3. Actual Results

The below error is presented in the logs and the authentication fails:

{noformat}
2015-02-26 20:35:20,904 http-bio-8080-exec-2 ERROR captain.planet 1235x15715x1 j7sdem 192.168.16.91 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/PEWPEW/incomingemail/validateemailforcreation [servicedesk.squalor.email.MailServerVerifier] Unable to connect to the server at outlook.office365.com due to the following exception: Unfortunately JIRA Service Desk couldn't connect to the mail server. Here is what the mail server said: "AUTHENTICATE failed."
{noformat}

h3.

Additionally the below error can occur during configuration:
!Office365 Shared Mailbox - Not working.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to use a shared mailbox
Portal comment form has attachments tab indexed before the save button.

Is there a way to configure the language of the email sent out to a user when they send an issue to Jira via the email collector if they do not have an account?  This is what I get right now:  

JIRA
Atlassian Cloud is the à la carte hosted development and collaboration solution for teams building great software. Log in now to track your issues and tasks, collaborate with your team, and stay on top of project activity.
Username:	username@me.com                                         
Email:	username@me.com                                         
Full Name:                                         	Kirk Henry
Get started by setting your own password and logging in.
Set my password                                                      
Don't worry. You can always ask for a new password using the following link: 
https://seiservices.atlassian.net/secure/ForgotLoginDetails.jspa?username=username%40me.com

This message may be confusing to our users as they are not aware of the helpdesk platform and are expecting to hear from us rather than Jira.  Thanks.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1578].
  {panel}

This issue occurred when trying to find a way to open "find a solution" Confluence page in then own window (e.g. so you can interact with the Confluence page). There is not easy way (short of right clicking) that you can do this, this should be possible. 

But the bug can be seen in the attached screenshot.

Double clicking a result, essentially spawns two model windows the second contains extra characters.

You have to click cancel twice to get our of the modal view.
fields.summary: Double clicking results in the "find a solution" search injects characters into underlying page name.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1569].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Creating Issues along with Image Signature by Apple Mail or any other Email service which includes the attachment in body of mail and not footer(Gmail can be configured properly in footer), Creates Attachments

h3. Environment 
Using Apple Mail to create issue in JIRA Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
When user is using Apple Mail to send an email to JIRA SD in order to create issues, if there is any signature on that email regardless of the image being inside the body of email or in the footer of the email. JIRA creates attachments 
Image signatures of the emails by Apple Mail appear as attachment in the ticket. So, multiple replies may create many attachments which need to be removed manually and it triggers the issue update event which results in receiving unwanted notification to users.  

Below is the part of the original message from Apple Mail, which shows that the image signature will be sent as part of content of the mail, not footer.
{code}
--Apple-Mail=_4A78E496-79D6-4AEB-BB9D-EBAA25EF99D9
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
Content-Disposition: inline;
	filename="AF04260C-C4F8-4357-9410-25719D1D08C8[18].png"
Content-Type: image/png;
	name="AF04260C-C4F8-4357-9410-25719D1D08C8[18].png"
Content-Id: <79034FE9-D9CF-4811-93FC-C499B27C81DC@rhodon.com>
{code}
and below is the part of the mail which has been sent using Gmail and it can be seen that the image is in footer and will be ignored by JIRA and does not create any attachments
{code}
--001a1134b9644e9875050fdeae4d
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8

This has an image as the footer.

*USERNAME*
*Support Engineer*
LOCATION AND PHONE NUMBER

--001a1134b9644e9875050fdeae4d
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The expect result is any image other than those in footer to be added as an attachment, but it does not happen by Apple mail
fields.summary: Creating Issues along with Image Signature by Apple Mail, Gmail and  etc, Creates Attachments
Ability to Generate a Report/Filter based on Service Desk Channel
As an Agent I want to decide on workflow transitions weather the reporter should be informed via email or not.

It would be really useful for me to be able to copy a Customer portal settings configuration or to choose a Customer Portal System (for instance, as done for permissions system, or notifications system or demand scheme system or screen system).

Thank you !

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1556].
  {panel}

Our company policy doesn't allow to delete any issues so I modified Service Desk permission scheme - I removed almost all *Delete Issues* permission entries. 
Now I got warning that *This service desk project may not work as expected.* (screens attached)
This dialog is visible all the time for both Project Administrators and Agents.
Additionally Project Administrators can revert JIRA Administrator's changes. According to me they shouldn't have such possibility but it is another issue.

I think that such changes should be possible and notification should be displayed only once just after change and disappear after confirmation and shouldn't bothering other people especially agents who doesn't have to know technical aspects.
fields.summary: Permission scheme verification warning should be displayed only once

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1555].
  {panel}

Let's say you have an request type "access" where customers can request user accounts for a specific system.
You have fields like:
* First name
* Last name
* Role
* Location
* Permission multi select list
* Cost centre
* Department

This works great for 1 request but it takes to long if a customer requests access for multiple colleagues. 

It would be great to have the "create another" feature from normal jira view with a little bit more control where you can say "keep this fields" per request type.
fields.summary: Add the ability to "create another" request and keep field input
Add ability to create customer notes that persist across tickets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1540].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Resolve/Close request transitions in a Service Desk instance do not trigger the appropriate notifications to Agents/JIRA Users according to the notification scheme.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Define users/groups under the Issue Resolved and/or Issue Closed notification settings of a Service Desk project's notification scheme.
# Create a Service Desk request in the Service Desk of step 1
# Resolve the request of step 2

h3. Expected Results
The users or members of the group as defined under step 1 should receive notifications of the request being resolved

h3. Actual Results
The members of the group or entities do not receive any notifications of the request resolution

h3. Root cause
In the Service Desk default generated workflow, the transition that resolves requests fires a Generic Event in the transition post-functions.
The notification scheme however acts on the Issue Resolved event. Since this is not defined in the post-functions, no notifications will be send.

h3. Workaround
There are 2 possible workarounds for this issue.
# Add the users/groups in the notification scheme to the "Generic Event" instead of the "Issue Resolved" notification. This will however trigger notifications on all Generic Events within that project to the defined user/groups
# In the relevant workflows, change the "Fire a Generic event" to "Fire a Issue Resolved event". Ensure you do this for all resolve issue transitions in all workflows, and do not forget to publish the workflows after the changes have been made in order for the changes to take effect
fields.summary: JSD default/generated workflow, "Resolve this issue" transition is firing Generic Event

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1526].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The reports based on Metric called Resolution would not give any results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Dummy ServiceDesk project and navigate to the "SLA" tab.
# Create a "New Metric" called "Resolution".
# Configure the Metric, for example:
!res.PNG|thumbnail!
# Create a several issues which met the Metric Goals.
# Change the system date to make those ticket breached and resolve the ticket to stop the SLA timer.
# Then, navigate to "Reports" tab and create a "New Report"
# Add a series and configured like in the screenshot below:
!report.PNG|thumbnail!
# Save the report.

h3. Expected Results
The graph and number will be updated with all breached issue created before.

h3. Actual Results
The graph is not updated and the number of breached issue still "0".
!graph.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* The same results will be thrown with "Met" condition
* It is possible that it is due to the same name with the Resolution System Field
fields.summary: Reports based on Metric called Resolution would not give any results.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1525].
  {panel}

Error when creating Service Desk request with Notify Hipchat post function in Create Issue transition. This might be related to having username that has a combination of uppercase and lowercase letter as well. 


*Steps to Reproduce* 
# Access Customer Portal with a Username that has combination of uppercase and lowercase letters. 
# Tried to create a request with *Notify Hipchat* post function in the create issue transition 
# Getting an error 
!error.PNG|thumbnail!
# JIRA logs is showing 
{noformat}
2015-02-16 12:32:06,275 TP-Processor25 ERROR PJoseph 752x192301x1 p764so 211.25.19.194,165.254.226.162 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/create/54 [feature.customer.request.ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager] Error initializing workflow
java.lang.NullPointerException

        at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.executeFunction(AbstractWorkflow.java:1050)

        at com.opensymphony.workflow.AbstractWorkflow.initialize(AbstractWorkflow.java:615)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager$$anonfun$initializeWorkflow$1$$anonfun$apply$1$$anonfun$apply$2.apply(ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.scala:60)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager$$anonfun$initializeWorkflow$1$$anonfun$apply$1$$anonfun$apply$2.apply(ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.scala:58)
        at scalaz.$bslash$div$class.map(Either.scala:94)
        at scalaz.$bslash$div$minus.map(Either.scala:283)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager$$anonfun$initializeWorkflow$1$$anonfun$apply$1.apply(ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.scala:58)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager$$anonfun$initializeWorkflow$1$$anonfun$apply$1.apply(ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.scala:56)
        at scalaz.$bslash$div$class.flatMap(Either.scala:117)
        at scalaz.$bslash$div$minus.flatMap(Either.scala:283)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager$$anonfun$initializeWorkflow$1.apply(ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.scala:56)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager$$anonfun$initializeWorkflow$1.apply(ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.scala:54)
        at scalaz.$bslash$div$class.flatMap(Either.scala:117)
        at scalaz.$bslash$div$minus.flatMap(Either.scala:283)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.initializeWorkflow(ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.scala:54)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.initializeWorkflowForIssue(ServiceDeskWorkflowInitializationManager.scala:35)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.CustomerRequestManager.com$atlassian$servicedesk$internal$feature$customer$request$CustomerRequestManager$$saveIssueIntoJIRA(CustomerRequestManager.scala:128)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.CustomerRequestManager$$anonfun$createRequest$2$$anonfun$apply$1$$anonfun$apply$2.apply(CustomerRequestManager.scala:82)
        at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.CustomerRequestManager$$anonfun$createRequest$2$$anonfun$apply$1$$anonfun$apply$2.apply(CustomerRequestManager.scala:73)
        at scalaz.$bslash$div$class.flatMap(Either.scala:117)

*Possible Workaround*
Check if the username has combination of uppercase and lowercase letters. Try to replace it with all lowercase and check how it goes.

Dear Support, 

we want to use Jira Service Desk for our agents, but something important ist mossing, maybe I did not find the right answers yes:

1.) MANDATORY: tickets shall be reopened, if the ticket is closed / resolved and the customers adds a new comment in the customer portal
2.) would be good: customers should be able to close a ticket in the portal
3.) IMPORTANT: We want to have prepared answers that we can use to anser tickets with prepared text tempates -- this is tracked via https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-631.


Thank you for your answer.

I was looging e.g. for the answer for question 1 for many hours without success.

We have installed the latest version of jira service desk on our server.


br
Markus Häusler
